metadata.title: U.S. West Coast Ocean Time Series Data by PMEL Data Rescue (PMEL EPIC)

creators.name: Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)

metadata.description: One-dimensional ocean data from the U.S. west coast.  Collected data include temperature, pressure, salinity, conductivity, etc.  There are 17 files available for plotting and download.  Depth ranges from 41 to 491 meters deep.  On-line access to the data and sectional cross plots is available.  Access to download data from individual casts in either ASCII or netCDF format is included.  A variety of plots of properties versus depth and property versus property plots can be generated on the fly and displayed to your screen.  On-line access to the data are accessible via a number of data selection utilities.  These utilities allow you to search the database and extract datasets meeting criteria such as geographic location, date and time, season of the year, and various other criteria.  Data were collected by the
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To rescue and disseminate old ocean time series data collected by scientists at the Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: None
